reviews.text:
Antiques market. Nice and busy.
No wafel stand but lots of old stuff. 
Once a month. Going again soon
You can see different church architecture styles from other places and you can feel the sacredness.
Good place, not the oldest churc but it's well kept.
Beautiful big cathedral in the centre of the city. And it is free.

Beautiful historical basilica. The dome and ceilings are very beautifully painted. Well maintained. I've been to many well known cathedrals and I still think this is pretty impressive - maybe it's just because I still haven't figured out how these master painters paint the domes and ceilings with such perfection...

Antiques market. Nice and busy.
No wafel stand but lots of old stuff. 
Once a month. Going again soon
You can see different church architecture styles from other places and you can feel the sacredness.
Good place, not the oldest churc but it's well kept.
Beautiful big cathedral in the centre of the city. And it is free.

Beautiful historical basilica. The dome and ceilings are very beautifully painted. Well maintained. I've been to many well known cathedrals and I still think this is pretty impressive - maybe it's just because I still haven't figured out how these master painters paint the domes and ceilings with such perfection...

Evangélikus gyülekezet
Istentisztelet: minden vasárnap 10:00

One of the oldest orthodox church  in Eger.built by serbian diaspor in Eger with the personal permission of Franc Iosif - Austrian Emperor.  Altar part is very beautiful with gilded gold frames like in all russian orthodox churches but of course requires restoration. There is painting made by russian icon painter. Entrance fee is 400huf. For next  400 huf you can buy a candle to light up in front of the altar. Recommended for all orthodox visitors of the city.
Lovely Orthodox Church with a nice view. Very peaceful, a nice place to go to relax.
Ruined but very nice
српска православна црква посвећена светом Николи, која сведочи о некад бројној српској заједници на овим просторима; унутар ње се налази богато декорисан икиностас
Fantasztikus ikonosztáz. Az egyik lebbagyobb!
Beautiful catholic church in the main square of Eger. Majestic from both the inside and outside!
Nice church worth visiting if you are around
It's a must to visit whenever You are in Eger!
must to visit
Wonderful baroque church with very harmoneous interior decorations.
Beautiful catholic church in the main square of Eger. Majestic from both the inside and outside!
Nice church worth visiting if you are around
It's a must to visit whenever You are in Eger!
must to visit
Wonderful baroque church with very harmoneous interior decorations.
Beautiful catholic church in the main square of Eger. Majestic from both the inside and outside!
Nice church worth visiting if you are around
It's a must to visit whenever You are in Eger!
must to visit
Wonderful baroque church with very harmoneous interior decorations.
Impressive tour every 2 hours, good multilingual guide
Nothing really special. Not much to see. The history is very interesting though. For tourists with another language than Hungarian, it's possible to have a guide booklet.

Interesting experience. If you have the option choose the mulled wine tour, they have some really interesting recipes. For example the "rum-orange" or the "dried plum and cinnamon" are the best. The tour itself is really interesting complete with technical details of how such a huge and complex cellar system could stay functional throughout the years. Disclaimer: I understand Hungarian.

Lady on the desk unable to speak English or provide any information , we were not able to stay and find out more  as parking meter was running out , so we left . Hope to try this one again next time we visit
Interesting place under the town. It was used as a wine cellar for the church. If you like half-lit labyrinths then it is a must for you. Tour starts at every hour and takes about 45 minutes.

You have to go up there and experience the narrow and steep steps.
Oh, and the rail up top is at knee height. A quite thrilling experience
Original Turkish structure, the most northern one. Fully renovated.

A tower, built by the Turkish, about 500 years ago, today you can climb the stairs and get on top of it, in case they are trying to stabilize it because it's old and kinda tilted, it looks like it's a rocket that they are about to launch (like on the picture). update: they fixed it now.
Cosy square.
I hand good times in eger so all was looks good to me
I was here 10 years ago and the place was amazing. Now it got bigger, the food terrible and the service is poor. Such a shame!
Tasty and huge pancakes. The staff was kind and helpfull. No credit card payment, but highly recommend the place.
Great salty and sweet pancakes but the waiting time can be really long. The location of the restaurant is great, it's right next to the castle, and parking is relatively easy in the area.

We went here as a family to celebrate, the selection is plentiful, from vegetable, to asian, hungarian, sweet and savoury. Portions are huge, you most likely will not be able to finish one plate on your own. The filling of the custard pancake was below standard, tasted like some preserved long life custard, however the spinach and fried egg pancake that i had selected was delicious and wonderful! There is a nice selection of wine, hot and cold drinks, the waiters were attentive and the bathroom was clean. I believe there is also free wifi, however the parking is a challenge in the area!
Highly recommended delicious pancakes, don't miss it If you are in Eger.

What a food and I really liked the service. Great place to go for wild lovers. Atmosphere is great with some live gipsy & Hungarian music. 
Wine card is excellent too. 
Just go!

Enjoyed a very lovely dinner here, with gorgeous food, soothing atmosphere and real oldschool waitresses, blessed with all the nuances of the trade. 

Started panicing a little when two gypsy musicians showed up, one of them with a violin. I am not a great fan of the genre. But to my greatest surprise they played rather cool lounge music, it really added to the mood. 

I will surely return. That boar soup though... yum :)

Terribly rude staff. I would not even give it a single star. Customer service  or first impressions at least were atrocious and I walked out. First rule of any business is treat your customers with respect. Never talk down to them. I was told that I wouldn't be served at the bar (while I was waiting for other people to arrive). But it was the way I was told that I found offensive. So impolite that I immediately felt as if I didn't want to be spending money at this place.
Great food,kind waiters,nice atmosphere,recommend to all meat lovers😄
All was perfect. Delicious food and professional waiters. There was cheap price.

Last summer I visited this place before. Then I thought that place was awesome. This time I was a little bit disappointed. The pizza was good quality but I saw the two "guys" who were making the pizza. Their clothes were less then clean, the bathroom was under my expectation.

Very delicious, good quality pizza. Probably the best I have ever eaten so far. To be fair I don't really keen on pizza but it is obvious that I will go back there. Inexpensive and good service as well.

Very tasty, thin crust pizza with various toppings and loots of cheese ;) The service is fast and they're very polite. They don't take card unfortunately.
P.S. We spent 3 days in Eger, we ate here twice.

The Pizza is big, but the ham looks and taste like out of the cheap packed ham package (Aldi or Lidl perhaps). The small, very warm and not ventilated sitting area upstairs is reachable by a very steep stairway, and 2 people slipped and fall down from the stairway.
Cash only
Great pizza, huge size, decently priced and perfectly made. A must visit! Although, because it tastes so great, it gets really busy and you may need to sit outside.

Great place to visit and see the style of cellars and gave a glass of wine. We did not eat in the area as it is more touristy. The menus seem basic and traditional, and the wine lists reflective of the region.
Just great place for a little walk and a lot of wine to enjoy. You can find there what you are looking for if you are a wine lover.
Superb. All these nice wine cellars. Real hungarian food. Go and taste the black cherries if you can. Pastry and palinka.
the place is not exceptional but you can find really nice traditional winery tasting places. You can find good wines with medal honors.

I can recommend Petrény Cellar 47th. They had several great wines and the winemaker man could talk a lot of interesting things about wines. Be careful, if u come in November, then only few cellars are open after 8pm. So if you can do, arrive earlier.
